cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 170 miles WSW of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to turn northwest then north-northeast, cross the northeast Gulf, make landfall along Florida’s Big Bend on Thursday and sweep northeastward across GA/SC, moving offshore near the NC coast by early Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Cedar Key–Apalachicola)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, then coastal GA, SC and southeastern NC (including Cape Fear to Cape Lookout)
weather_observation.wind: Gusty easterly to northeasterly winds could reach 30–40 mph late Thursday night into Friday morning
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–3 ft possible along the lower Cape Fear River and adjacent beaches during onshore flow as the system exits
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 4–6 inches of rain with locally higher amounts in squalls as the center passes inland then offshore
weather_observation.other_hazards: Short-lived tornado threat in outer rain bands Thursday night–Friday; hazardous seas and rip currents likely to disrupt pilot/berthing operations
